casebody.data:
VEADER N. LEONARD ET AL. v. SHARPE & DOHME, INC. LNo. 29,

October Term, 1940.]

Decided November 13th, 1940.

The cause was argued before Bond, C. J. Parke, Sloan, Mitchell, Johnson, and Delaplaine, JJ.

Randolph Barton, Jr., and F. Fulton Bramble, with whom was Joseph Addison on the brief, for appellants. Charles Markell, with whom were Henry S. Drinker and Philip Wallis on the brief, for the appellee.

The opinion, which was delivered Per Curian, affirms the decree, each party to pay its own costs.
